Package main

Class Animal

java.lang.Object
main.Produce
main.Animal
public class Animal
extends Produce
Extends the Produce class to implement Animals, which are raised on the farm. It includes happiness and healthiness attributes, as well as dailyIncome, which is the amount of money earned from tending to the animal each day.
Version:
1.0, May 2020.
Author:
Alina Phang, Jesper Slager

    Constructs an instance of Animal

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.lang.String basicDetails()
    Gets only the name and daily income of the animal (for inventory)
    boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)
    Two instances of Animal are the same type if they have the same name, price and daily income
    void feed​(FoodItem f)
    Increases the animal's healthiness by the amount given by the food item, up to a maximum of 120
    int getBonus()  
    int getDailyIncome()  
    void getDepression()
    Decreases the animal's happiness by 3 points, down to a minimum of 0 (used in the broken fence random event)
    int getHappiness()  
    int getHealth()  
    int getIncome()  
    int getInitialHealth()  
    void happinessBonus()
    Increases the animal's happiness by 1 point, up to a maximum of 10
    void loseHappiness()
    Decreases the animal's happiness by 1 point, down to a minimum of 0 (used when moving to the next day)
    void loseHealth()
    Decreases the animal's health by 12 points, down to a minimum of 0 (used when moving to the next day)
    void play()
    Increases the animal's happiness by 3 points, up to a maximum of 10
    java.lang.String toDetailedString()
    Gets the details of the animal including happiness and healthiness (for farm status)

  • Constructor Details

    • Animal

      public Animal​(java.lang.String name, int purchasePrice, int animalHappiness, int animalHealth, int revenue)
      Constructs an instance of Animal
      Parameters:
      name - The type of animal
      purchasePrice - The cost to buy this animal
      animalHappiness - The happiness of the animal (out of 10)
      animalHealth - The health of the animal (out of 120)
      revenue - The daily income received from tending to the animal

  • Method Details

    • getHappiness

      public int getHappiness()
      Returns:
      The happiness of the animal

    • getHealth

      public int getHealth()
      Returns:
      The health of the animal

    • getInitialHealth

      public int getInitialHealth()
      Returns:
      The initial health of the animal

    • getBonus

      public int getBonus()
      Returns:
      The daily money bonus based on the animal's happiness and healthiness levels

    • getDailyIncome

      public int getDailyIncome()
      Returns:
      The daily income provided by the animal based on happiness and healthiness

    • getIncome

      public int getIncome()
      Returns:
      The income provided by the animal

    • basicDetails

      public java.lang.String basicDetails()
      Gets only the name and daily income of the animal (for inventory)
      Returns:
      A string containing the animal's name and daily income provided

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Gets the important information of the animal (for store)
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      A string containing the animal's name, purchase price and daily income provided

    • toDetailedString

      public java.lang.String toDetailedString()
      Gets the details of the animal including happiness and healthiness (for farm status)
      Returns:
      A string containing the animal's name, purchase price, daily income provided, healthiness and happiness

    • feed

      public void feed​(FoodItem f)
      Increases the animal's healthiness by the amount given by the food item, up to a maximum of 120
      Parameters:
      f - The food item being used

    • loseHealth

      public void loseHealth()
      Decreases the animal's health by 12 points, down to a minimum of 0 (used when moving to the next day)

    • play

      public void play()
      Increases the animal's happiness by 3 points, up to a maximum of 10

    • happinessBonus

      public void happinessBonus()
      Increases the animal's happiness by 1 point, up to a maximum of 10

    • loseHappiness

      public void loseHappiness()
      Decreases the animal's happiness by 1 point, down to a minimum of 0 (used when moving to the next day)

    • getDepression

      public void getDepression()
      Decreases the animal's happiness by 3 points, down to a minimum of 0 (used in the broken fence random event)

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)
      Two instances of Animal are the same type if they have the same name, price and daily income
      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object
      Parameters:
      o - An object to compare
      Returns:
      true if the animals are the same type, false otherwise
